definition: Bing Xin (1900-1999), female poet and children's writer

sentences.english: The sky a bright moon, video card two Bingxin.
sentences.chinese: 天上一輪明月，映證兩顆冰心。

sentences.english: Brenda Lee, a staff member of Oxfam Hong Kong, recently visited Nepal on a documentation trip.
sentences.chinese: 李冰心爲樂施會職員，最近探訪尼泊爾以作文件紀錄。

sentences.english: Bingxin's proses made great contributions to establish a standard for modern Chinese language.
sentences.chinese: 冰心散文對建立現代漢語的典範卓有貢獻。

sentences.english: Bingxin is the classic representative of love philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 冰心是愛的哲學的典範代表。

sentences.english: Later, I had the chance to interview the almost century-old famous writer in China, Bing Xin.
sentences.chinese: 後來，我又在醫院採訪了世紀老人冰心。

sentences.english: Modern Chinese language standard was established through the help of Bingxin's prose.
sentences.chinese: 冰心散文對建立現代漢語的典範卓有貢獻。

sentences.english: Bing Xin never covered up her relation with religion.
sentences.chinese: 冰心從不隱諱自己同宗教的關係。

sentences.english: Forgive my one ice heart, heaven can Jian.
sentences.chinese: 原諒我一片冰心，蒼天可鑑。

This book of poems, I have to have more ice cores into a layer of understanding.
sentences.chinese: 這本詩集後，我對冰心有了更進一層的瞭解。

sentences.english: Preface, introduces the bing xin's life.
sentences.chinese: 序言中，介紹了冰心的一生。

sentences.english: The thesis introduces the creation of Bing Xin Literary Hall.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了冰心文學館的創作構思。

sentences.english: Contemporary prose, there is also a long prose, such as the South GUI Bing Xin.
sentences.chinese: 當代散文中，也有長篇散文，如冰心的《南歸》。

sentences.english: Because water puts a heart on the ice and Sha Wu and Tie Zhongyu roughhouse.
sentences.chinese: 沙武和鐵中玉因水冰心而大打出手。

sentences.english: He is always morally pure and indifferent to fame and fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他從來都是這樣淡泊名利，一片冰心。

sentences.english: Bing Xin was fortunate to have parents who encouraged her to study and write.
sentences.chinese: 冰心很幸運地有鼓勵她學習和寫作的父母。

definition: Ba Jin (1904-2005), novelist, author of the trilogy 家, 春, 秋
Xiao Qian (1910-1999), Mongolian-born, Cambridge-educated journalist active during Second World War in Europe, subsequently famous author and translator
Ding Ling (1904-1986), female novelist, author of novel The Sun Shines over the Sanggan River 太陽照在桑乾河上|太阳照在桑干河上, attacked during the 1950s as anti-Party
Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
Ye Shengtao (1894-1988), writer and editor, known esp. for children's books
Xu Dishan (1893-1941), journalist, publisher and novelist
Lao She (1899-1966), Chinese novelist and dramatist
Xiao Hong (1911-1942), prominent woman writer, originally from Heilongjiang
